title: Blinken arrives in Beijing amid deep fissures in U.S.-China relations
description: The top U.S. diplomat began a two-day trip amid accusations from Beijing that Washington alone is to blame for the historic rupture in relations.

title: Here’s what to know about rebels accused of attacking a Ugandan school
description: The Allied Democratic Forces killed at least 37 people at a Ugandan school on Friday, authorities said. Here's what to know about the Islamic State-linked rebels.

title: King Charles on horseback for his first Trooping the Colour birthday
description: Charles is the first king to ride in the parade since 1950, the year before George VI died.

title: Colombian forces who saved lost children vow to find dog that guided them
description: The military dog helped Colombian forces find four children who went missing when their plane crashed in the jungle, forcing them to survive alone for 40 days.

title: How four children survived Amazon plane crash, 40 days alone in jungle
description: The 95-minute flight over the Colombian Amazon was supposed to deliver the children, ranging in age from 11 months to 13 years, to safety. Their mother died in the crash.

title: At least 25 dead in school attack in Uganda, police say
description: Police said the Allied Democratic Forces rebel group carried out the attack at a school near the border with the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

title: Singer of German rock band Rammstein faces sexual assault accusations
description: Numerous women have accused frontman Till Lindemann of sexually assaulting fans during his private parties at the concerts.

title: Ukraine live briefing: African delegation travels to Russia to push Putin for peace talks
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa is leading the visiting party, which first stopped in Kyiv on Friday as the Ukrainian capital was being hit by Russian missiles.

title: To fight Putin, Russian militias aid Ukraine with cross-border attacks
description: With cross-border raids, militias aim to give Russian civilians a taste of the death and destruction that President Vladimir Putin’s war has wrought on Ukraine.
